children.value: This rule applies to any element with the
: This rule only applies to elements with the

of heading. Thus, it is a partial check for WCAG 2.0 success criterion 2.4.6, which applies to all headings. "Heading" is used in its general sense and includes headlines and other ways to add a heading to different types of content. This includes elements that are not marked up as headings in the code, but still act visually as headings, e.g. by larger and/or bolder text.
Each target element describes the topic or purpose of its
: Headings do not need to be lengthy. A word, or even a single character, may suffice.
There are no major accessibility support issues known for this rule.
Understanding Success Criterion 2.4.6: Headings and Labels
H42: Using h1-h6 to identify headings
ARIA12: Using role=heading to identify headings
element that describes the topic or purpose of its

<h1 class="target">Opening Hours</h1>
<p>We are open Monday through Friday from 10 to 16</p>
that describes the topic or purpose of its

<span role="heading" aria-level="1">Opening Hours</span>
<p>We are open Monday through Friday from 10 to 16</p>
that describes the topic or purpose of its

<span role="heading">Opening Hours</span>
<p>We are open Monday through Friday from 10 to 16</p>
element with an image that describes the topic or purpose of its

<h1 class="target">
	<img scr="/test-assets/descriptive-heading-b49b2e/opening_hours_icon.png" alt="Opening hours" />
</h1>
<p>We are open Monday through Friday from 10 to 16</p>
element that is a single character that describes the topic or purpose of its

<h1 class="target">A</h1>
<dl>
	<dt>airplane</dt>
	<dd>
		a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.
	</dd>
	<dt>apple</dt>
	<dd>
		the round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin green or red skin and crisp flesh.
	</dd>
</dl>
that describes the topic or purpose of its
. The heading is positioned off screen and is

<p style="position: absolute; top: -9999px; left: -9999px;">
	We are open Monday through Friday from 10 to 16
</p>

<p>We are open Monday through Friday from 10 to 16</p>
